Lack of balance, extremely one-dimensional meta (which leads to only a few competitive characters and perks,) no new game modes in like 6 years, and to top it all off, an openly uncaring development team. The only thing "scary" about Dead by Daylight is the fact that eventually, you'll realize you've sunk countless hours into a game you're not even enjoying.

The game requires you to be alert at all times, which is quite addictive. hihi

One of my all time favorite games. Lots of fun as both killer and survivor. Each killer has unique game play mechanics and the majority of them i find enjoyable. You can play the game completely free for the most part, only forced to pay if you want a licensed character. All original characters are unlock able by earning in-game currency from each match played. A large amount of awesome cosmetics in the game and a good amount of them are purchasable with in-game earned currency. Game experience is best with a group of friends when playing survivor or playing custom matches with a full party of 5 people. Overall i would give the game a 8/10 Due to a large amount of bugs in the game with each new patch, but i still very much enjoy the game in spite of the bugs that appear very infrequently.

this game is amazing i play it with my friends all the time

Don't get me wrong, this game CAN be fun, but the new MMR system, mixed with stubborn devs, really hurt the game. Dead By Daylight is not a fun competitive game, and in my opinion it was never meant to be played as competitive as it is now. The new MMR system has forced a much more competitive game play experience on players, due to how it works. The community still mostly asks for this system to be changed, and nothing. It took Dead By Daylight losing most of its players when they just let hackers run wild for weeks for the devs to finally listen to anything, but they still haven't made some changes that  need to be made. This game is a fun game to custom lobby with friends in, and it can be fun if you get lucky and get a lobby of your actual skill level. But should you get stuck with a really high MMR rating like myself just because you secure one kill or manage to escape through the hatch, you get lobby after lobby of people who have way more hours and are just much better then you. Losing is fine, it teaches you, but no one wants to play a game, lose 20 times in a row, and 19 of those times the people decide to be excessively toxic at the end because that's over half the community this game has. This game used to be very fun, but once the new MMR system arrived, more and more players are just calling it quits. There are better multiplayer games out there, and Dead By Daylight will eventually die out if the devs don't find a better way to gain players then adding some movie Killer to the game.

Nah the survivors say the killers are overpowered and the killers whine and cry that the survivors are overpowered. Play at your own peril, hugely toxic where kindness and compassion are actively ignored. But fr tho beating the shit out of Steve and then putting him on a hook makes me be able to sleep at night.

After all my hours of playing this game, I can say I've run into the most colorful communities. I enjoy playing killer and I main survivor. Both sides have their pros and cons, but no match will ever be like the last. This can lead to some intense matches against sweaty survivors, or hilarious moments with a friendly killer. 8/10 would recommend.
Annoying but fun. Constantly getting hooked and dying, but fun. Constantly running into AFK killers who farm for bloodpoints, but fun. It's fun.

This game was very good in the past and I really enjoyed it. However the problems I had with this game over the last few months make it feel like some messy code. This may just happened to me, but my controls have been messed with after an update and the performance dropped on my PC. My PC may isnt the newest but it could run DBD just fine before 2 Updates ago. Even with grafic settings on the minimum there are moments where my screen just freezes randomly. My PC is also way better than the minimum to run this game, if you read the specs from the steam page to run this game. 
Now that we have gone through the problems with the new updates, we now come to the community. The community is a bit toxic, however for my part I got a good expirience with the community. I recommend playing this game with some friends or just play KYF (Custom Games) with a group of 4 friends directly.
Finally I can say that this is a good game and if performance issues have been fixed I could see myself enjoying it again. If you have a beefy PC and some friends with the game it can work out pretty nice, but for a solo horror/killer expirience this game is not what you are looking for.
Over all a fun game takes a bit to get into a game sometimes and cam be a bit toxic

If I'm being genuinely honest, the game is trash, very very very very very very very much trash. However, the only reason I bring myself to keep coming back and playing this game is because looping exist and looping is very very very very very fun (when it goes well.) If it were not for good looping which is decided by several factors but mainly the individual. So, I cannot recommend this game because every time I get on it, I'm complaining because there's many things to complain about. Also, almost every match unless perhaps playing with 3 friends... you get a lot of teammates that don't exactly think. What I mean by that is, just that... they don't think and they suck, very much so. I'm not trying to shame players that aren't good but, when you get better yourself and then constantly get players at a lower mmr than what you are in, ITS ANNOYING AND DUMB and the game just sucks. But hey, if you want to give it a try and take your chances I'd say DON'T.

It's fun, it's horror, it's more fun with friends and more horror with good killers and you need a huge anger tolerance :)
Good game.  My friend harasses me to play it.

Very funny at first, then becomes outright frustrating. At some point you'll worry more about not getting angry at the abundant grieving you'll receive then actually playing mind games and planning. The company cares more about virtue-signalling about political correctness and ''inclusive'' then balancing the game or doing anything about it's problems, issues that have nothing to do with the game itself. They don't respect their playerbase at all, and ultimately only aim towards money and clout. nothing else. You'll stumble upon more and more grieving squads and more often than not leave the game frustrated.

Don't get this game, really.
